form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Udall of Colorado (for himself and Mr. Bennet) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to facilitate paid television service in certain counties, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Colorado News, Emergency, Weather, and Sports Act of 2014.

section.header: Facilitating delivery of relevant television programming to unserved consumers

subsection.text: Section 341(a) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 341(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (1)(A), by striking in the county on January 1, 2004; or and inserting the following: “in the county—

clause.text: on January 1, 2004, in the case of a county described in paragraph (3)(A); or
on January 1, 2014, in the case of a county described in paragraph (3)(B); or

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subparagraphs (A) through (C) as clauses (i) through (iii), respectively, and adjusting the margins accordingly;
in the matter preceding clause (i), as redesignated, by striking means any 1 of 4 counties that— and inserting the following: “means—
by striking the period at the end and inserting the following: “; or

clause.text: are all in a single State;
on January 1, 2014, were each in designated market areas in which the majority of counties were located in another State; and
as a group had a combined total of 27,540 television households according to the U.S. Television Household Estimates by Nielsen Media Research for 2013–2014.

subsection.text: Section 122(a)(4)(C) of title 17, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating clauses (i) and (ii) as subclauses (I) and (II), respectively, and adjusting the margins accordingly;
in the matter preceding clause (I), as redesignated, by striking In the case of and all that follows and inserting the following: “In the case of—

clause.text: that State in which are located 4 counties that—

paragraph.text: in subclause (II), as redesignated, by adding or at the end;
by inserting after subclause (II), as redesignated, the following:

clause.text: that State in which are located 2 counties that—

subclause.text: on January 1, 2014, were in local markets principally comprised of counties in another State, and
had a combined total of 27,540 television households, according to the U.S. Television Household Estimates by Nielsen Media Research for 2013–2014,

paragraph.text: by inserting before the period at the end the following: , in the case of the State described in clause (i), or on January 1, 2014, in the case of the State described in clause (ii).
